lætað þæt we geseon hwæðer Helias cume hine nyþer to settanne.
WSCp MARK 15.37 Se hælend þa asende his stefne & forðferde.
WSCp MARK 15.38 & þæs temples wahrift wæs tosliten on twa of ufewerdum oð neoþewerd.
WSCp MARK 15.39 Þa se hundredman þe ðar stod agen geseah þæt se hælend swa clypiende forðferde he cwæð,
soðlice þes man wæs Godes sunu.
WSCp MARK 15.40 And þa wif wæron feorran behealdende
& betwux þam wæs seo Magdalenisce Maria & Maria, Iacobes modor, & Salomeæ.
WSCp MARK 15.41 & þa he wæs on Galilea hi fylidon him & him þenedon
& manega oðre þe him mid ferdon on Hierusalem.
WSCp MARK 15.42 And þa æfen wæs geworden þæt wæs Parasceue þæt is ær Sæterdæge. WSCp MARK 15.43 Þa com Iosep se æðela gerefa of Abarimathia se sylfa Godes rices geanbidode
& he dyrstiglice into Pilate eode & bæd þæs hælendes lichaman.
WSCp MARK 15.44 Ða wundrode Pilatus gif he þa gyt forðferde;
þa clypode he þæne hundredman & hine ahsode hwæðer he dead wære.
WSCp MARK 15.45 Ða he wiste þæt, þa agef he þone lichaman Iosepe.
WSCp MARK 15.46 Þa bohte Iosep ane scytan & hine þaron befeold & on byrgene lede seo wæs of stane aheawen & wylte anne stan to ðære byrgenne dura.
WSCp MARK 15.47 Ða com Maria Magdalene & Iosepes Maria & beheoldon hwar he geled wære.
WSCp MARK 16.1 & ða Sæternes dæg wæs agan, seo Magdalenisce Maria & Iacobes Maria & Salomeę; bohton wyrtgemang þæt hi comon & hine smyredon.
WSCp MARK 16.2 And swyðe ær anum restedæge comon to þære byrgene upasprungenre sunnan. WSCp MARK 16.3 & cwædon him betwynan,
hwa awylt us ðysne stan of þære byrgene dura?
WSCp MARK 16.4 Þa hi hi besawon, hi gesawon þæne stan aweg awyltne;
Soðlice he wæs swyðe mycel.
WSCp MARK 16.5 And þa hi eodon on þa byrgene, hi gesawon anne geongne on þa swyðran healfe sittende hwitum gegyrlan oferwrohne
& hi þa forhtodon.
WSCp MARK 16.6 Ða cwæð he to him,
ne forhtige ge na;
Ge secað þæne Nazareniscan hælend ahangenne.
WSCp MARK 16.7 He aras,
nis he her;
Her is seo stow þær hi hine ledon.
Ac farað & secgað his leorningcnihtum & Petre þæt he gæð toforan eow on Galileam;
þar ge hine geseoð swa he eow sæde.
WSCp MARK 16.8 And hi ut eodon & flugon fram þære byrgene & wæron afærede for þære gesyhðe þe hi gesawon;
& hig nanon men naht ne sædon,
soðlice hi him adredon.
WSCp MARK 16.9 Þa he aras on ærnemorgen on restedæge; æryst he ætywde þære Magdaleniscan Marian of ðære he ut adraf seofon deofolseocnyssa.
WSCp MARK 16.10 & heo þa ut eode & hit þam cydde þe mid him wæron heofendum & wependum.
WSCp MARK 16.11 Þa hi gehyrdon þæt he leofode & hi hine gesawon þa ne gelyfdon hi him.
WSCp MARK 16.12 Æfter þam him twam he wæs ætywed on oðrum hiwe him on þone tun farendum.
WSCp MARK 16.13 & hi þa foron & þæt oðrum cyddon
& hi him ne gelyfdon.
WSCp MARK 16.14 Ða æt nehstan he ætywde him twelfum þar hi ætgædere sæton; & tælde hyra ungeleaffulnesse & hyra heortan heardnesse forðam þe hi ne gelyfdon þam ðe hine gesawon of deaþe arisan.
WSCp MARK 16.15 & he sæde him,
farað into ealne middaneard
& bodiað godspell ealre gesceafte.
WSCp MARK 16.16 Se þe gelyfð & gefullod bið, se biþ hal;
Soþlice se ðe ne gelyfð, se bið genyðerod.
WSCp MARK 16.17 Þas tacnu fyliað þam ðe gelyfað,
on minon naman hi deofolseocnessa utdrifað,
hi sprecaþ niwum tungum.
WSCp MARK 16.18 Næddran hi afyrrað
& him ne derað þeah hi hwæt deadbærlices drincan,
ofer seoce hi hyra handa settað
& hi beoð hale.
WSCp MARK 16.19 And witudlice Drihten hælend syððan he to him spræc he wæs on heofonum afangen
& he sitt on Godes swiðran healfe.
WSCp MARK 16.20 Soþlice hi ða farende æghwar bodedon Drihtne midwyrcendum & trymmendre spræce æfterfyligendum tacnum.
WSCp JOHN 1.1 On frymðe wæs word
